greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse binomial transform of A005614, the rabbit sequence: (1, 0, 1, 1, 0, ...).
comment: As with every inverse binomial transform, the numbers are given by starting from the sequence (A005614) and reading the leftmost values of the array of repeated differences.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
N. J. A. Sloane, Families of Essentially Identical Sequences, Mar 24 2021 (Includes this sequence)
xref: The following sequences are all essentially the same, in the sense that they are simple transformations of each other, with A000201 as the parent: A000201, A001030, A001468, A001950, A003622, A003842, A003849, A004641, A005614, A014675, A022342, A088462, A096270, A114986, A124841. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 11 2021
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 10 2006
ext: Corrected and extended by _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 28 2011
